New Records: The Chicago White Sox set a franchise record for losses in a single season with 107 losses.
Key Match Events: The Mets scored two runs, while the White Sox were unable to get anything going offensively.
Pre-Game Insights: Starting pitcher Garrett Crochet struck out eight batters, including an AL record-tying seven straight to start the game.
Post-Match Reflections: Interim manager Grady Sizemore pulled Crochet early to manage his inning count.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The White Sox will have major decisions to make following the season, and they may still have a chance to break the worst record of the modern era.
Others: The White Sox will be back in action on Monday against the Baltimore Orioles.
